title: How Delcy Rodríguez, Venezuela’s Leader, Became Vital to Trump’s Plans for the Country
summary: Delcy Rodríguez, a guerrilla’s daughter, started out as a provocateur. She pivoted to revive a ravaged economy, making her vital to U.S. plans to run Venezuela.

title: After President’s Capture, U.S. and Venezuela Explore Restoring Diplomatic Ties
summary: The move embodied the contradictions and fast-changing nature of the two countries’ relationship.

title: Trump’s $100 Billion Venezuela Oil Plan Gets a Cool Reception
summary: President Trump met with oil and gas executives on Friday in an effort to push them to invest money in Venezuela, a plan many of them are reluctant to embrace.

title: Inside Iran’s Protests: How a Plunging Currency Set Off Wide Unrest
summary: In a serious challenge to Iran’s authoritarian government, angry protests have spread from the markets and universities of major cities to the impoverished towns in the hinterland.

title: Trump Eyes Greenland, and Europe Figures Its Best Bet Is a Negotiation
summary: European officials were stunned that President Trump restated his desire for Greenland after a yearlong effort to dissuade him, according to diplomats and others.

title: Why Putin Went Quiet When Challenged by Trump Over Venezuela
summary: For the Russian leader, courting President Trump to secure a favorable resolution in Ukraine, and possibly more, is far more important.

title: What Happens if Federal Agents and Local Officers Stop Getting Along?
summary: Cooperation among law enforcement agencies is critical to many investigations, experts say. After a series of shootings by immigration agents, the relationship is showing cracks.

title: Judge Blocks Trump Officials From Freezing Billions in Social Services Funds
summary: The ruling temporarily halted plans to freeze more than $10 billion in funds for anti-poverty programs bound for five Democratic-led states.

title: She Was Born Two Days Before the Altadena Fire Took Her Home
summary: She was the family’s first baby in 16 years. And she came into their world as the Altadena fire changed everything. They struggled for months to find housing, stability and peace.

title: What Would Peace on Immigration Look Like?
summary: A tough issue for stabilization in our politics and public institutions.

title: The ‘Attention Economy’ Is a Lie
summary: It started in a laboratory. No one could have predicted where it would end.

title: Acquired Tastes
summary: The dream of cohabitating with a group of friends is an attractive fantasy, but we can benefit from its lessons, regardless of our living situation.

title: Do You Frequently Order Food Delivery? We Want to Hear From You.
summary: Your responses can help as we report on the immense growth of food delivery and its effects on how we live.

title: For Mamdani, 2 Contentious Hires Yield 2 Different Outcomes
summary: The past social media posts of two hires have led to a public debate about how much the new mayor is willing to tolerate.

title: Volkswagen Suffers More Than Rivals From Auto Industry Woes
summary: The German automaker’s sales in the United States plunged last year, hit by tariffs and the end of tax credits for electric vehicles.

title: I.C.C. Judges Denounce Effect of Trump’s Sanctions
summary: President Trump’s retaliation against top officials at the International Criminal Court has shut them out of American services and made even routine daily tasks a challenge.

title: Rare Comic Introducing Superman Sells Privately for $15 Million
summary: The copy of Action Comics No. 1, published in 1938, was stolen from the actor Nicolas Cage in 2000 and recovered more than a decade later.
